Tasks.Task Description: Identify the security requirements for accessing Azure VMs securely using Azure Bastion. Determine compliance needs and risk factors.
Create a design for the Azure Bastion deployment, including network topology, subnet configurations, and integration with existing security measures.
Provision a dedicated subnet for Azure Bastion in the virtual network. Ensure it meets the requirements for Azure Bastion deployment.
Deploy Azure Bastion in the created subnet. Configure the necessary settings for secure access to VMs.
Configure NSGs to restrict access to the Azure Bastion subnet. Define rules to allow only necessary traffic.
Enable security features such as Azure AD authentication and configure role-based access control (RBAC) for users accessing Azure Bastion.
Set up logging and monitoring for Azure Bastion using Azure Monitor and Azure Security Center. Ensure alerts are configured for suspicious activities.
Perform security testing, including penetration testing and vulnerability assessments, to identify potential weaknesses in the Azure Bastion setup.
Document the security policies and procedures related to Azure Bastion usage, including access controls and incident response plans.
Regularly review and update security configurations and policies for Azure Bastion to ensure compliance with security standards.
Conduct training sessions for staff on best practices for using Azure Bastion securely, including recognizing phishing attempts and secure access methods.
Regularly review and update security policies related to Azure Bastion to ensure they align with organizational security standards and best practices.
Continuously monitor Azure Bastion logs for any unauthorized access attempts or anomalies. Utilize Azure Monitor and Azure Security Center for alerts.
Perform regular security audits of Azure Bastion configurations and access controls to identify and remediate any vulnerabilities.
Ensure that Azure Bastion is updated to the latest version to benefit from security patches and new features. Schedule updates during maintenance windows.
Regularly review and update user access permissions to Azure Bastion to ensure that only authorized personnel have access.
Perform incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents involving Azure Bastion. Ensure familiarity with response protocols.
Regularly back up the configuration settings of Azure Bastion to ensure quick recovery in case of misconfiguration or failure.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular security training to stay updated with new threats and best practices related to Azure Bastion.
Ensure that Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enabled for all users accessing Azure Bastion to enhance security.
